beans.description:
This adaptor illustrates the usage of an SMTPWriteConnector
* It reads delimited records from file * It converts delimited input into a map * converts map to xml * Emails each record to configures target.
It is designed to illustrate the basic structure of a file reader/writer adaptor
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config smtp-writer.xml
The runtime classpath should include the following:
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar lib/opt/activation.jar lib/opt/mail.jar
Note that this example is configures with placeholders for:
* smtp mail host (smtp_host) * sender - smtp_from * receiver - smtp_to
These may be configured by specifying on the command line, or by reference to a properties file which contains the placeholder values e.g.
java -Dsmtp_host=stmp.mydomain.com -Dsmtp_from=me@myhost.com -Dsmtp_to=you@myhost.com org.openadaptor... or (assuming smtp.properties contains configured values) java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config smtp-writer.xml -props smtp.properties

bean.description: Configure simple pipeline Reader -> MapConverter -> XmlConvertor -> Writer.
This read connector reads lines from a file.
This (regular expression) will exclude comments (lines beginning with #)
Strings are delimited by commas; each value in the string will be associated with the corresponding 'name' in the generated map

This writer writes data to email as per the configuration of the smtp connection smtp_host - something like smtp.mailserver.com smtp_from - something like jane.doe@hermaildomain.com smtp_to - something like john.doe@mymaildomain.com See the adaptor description for options on how to configure these placeholder values
